import plotly.express as px
from plotly.figure_factory import create_table  # Used to create a dataframe like the pandas dataframe
source.d488bf2b:
gapminder = px.data.gapminder() # The gapminder dataset

# Create a beautiful table
table = create_table(gapminder.head(10))
py.iplot(table)
source.e6b16786:
# Let's explore the data about one country i.e. Canada
data_canada = gapminder.query("country == 'Canada'")

# Create a bar plot (Year vs Population)
fig = px.bar(data_canada, x='year', y='pop', height=400)
fig.show()
source.2e3a1a62:
# Create a bar plot (Year vs Poplulation) which also shows LifeExpectancy and GDP on hover and is coloured according to LifeExpectancy
fig = px.bar(data_canada,
             x='year',
             y='pop',
             hover_data=['lifeExp', 'gdpPercap'],
             color='lifeExp',
             labels={'pop': 'Population of Canada'},
             height=400
            )
fig.show()

px.scatter(gapminder2007,
           x='gdpPercap',

source.a54f4a10:
# Create a scatter plot (GDP vs LifeExpectancy) color it by continent and size it by country population and also show the country names on hover
px.scatter(gapminder2007,
           x='gdpPercap',
           y='lifeExp',
           color='continent',
           size='pop',
           size_max=60,
           hover_name='country')
source.9f24f468:
# Create the above scatter plot (GDP vs LifeExpectancy) and subplot it by continent (Facet Plot) make the x-axis logarithmic(so that we can see things clearly)
px.scatter(gapminder2007,
           x='gdpPercap',
           y='lifeExp',
           color='continent',
           size='pop',
           size_max=60,
           hover_name='country',
           facet_col='continent',
           log_x=True)
source.10123a3f:
# Create an animation to see the change by years
px.scatter(gapminder,
           x='gdpPercap',
           y='lifeExp',
           color='continent',
           size='pop',
           size_max=60,
           hover_name='country',
           animation_frame='year',
           animation_group='country',
           log_x=True,
           range_x=[100, 100000],
           range_y=[25, 90],
           labels={'pop': 'Population',
                   'gdpPercap': 'GDP per Capita',
                   'lifeExp': 'Life Expectancy'}
            )

# Shade the map by LifeExpectancy using choropleth with projection natural earth
px.choropleth(gapminder,
              locations='iso_alpha',
              color='lifeExp', 
              hover_name='country',
              animation_frame='year',
              color_continuous_scale=px.colors.sequential.Plasma,
              projection='natural earth')
